name: df-rgspn
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(crgspn, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), cint(crab(s2, cfv(csubrg, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ RingSpan =(s0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(s1 ∈ P((Base ` s0))↦ ⋂ { s2 ∈(SubRing ` s0)| s1 ⊆ s2 }))
comment: The ring-span of a set of elements in a ring is the smallest subring which contains all of them. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Dec-2014.)
